Description: Elephant ivory handle or terminal from a pin, cosmetic utensil or spindle; lathe-turned; concave moulding on the top with a flaring terminal, separate from a smaller convex element by incised lines; damaged at both ends and reassembled from three pieces.
Curator's comments: Malmgren, Klavdhia (pp. 104-105) interprets this as part of a cosmetic implement similar to an Egyptian kohl-stick. Material identified by François Popin in April 2007.
Bibliographic references: Malmgren 2003 / Klavdhia-Tremithos. A Middle and Late Cypriote Bronze Age site. (Cat. no. 161, p. 57 & pl. 38d; pp. 104-105)
Kiely 2011d / Klavdia-Tremithos: A Bronze Age community in south-east Cyprus (U.47)
